creator: david@catcode.com
text:
This is for batik-svgbrowser from beta2. Given a file small.svg with this
content (DOCTYPE omitted to save space

    <svg id="body" width="20" height="20">
    <title>Small Graphic</title>
    <rect x="0" y="0" width="15" height="15" fill="blue" stroke="black"/>
    </svg>

and file big.svg with this content:

    <svg id="body" width="200" height="200">
    <title>Test of image element</title>
    <image xlink:href="small.svg" x="10" y="10" width="20" height="20" />
    <circle cx="70" cy="70" r="30" fill="#99ff99" stroke="#99ff99"/>
    </svg>

Works great with svgviewer @version $Id: Main.java,v 1.15 2000/12/01, but the
beta2 batik-svgbrowser  @version $Id: Main.java,v 1.5 2001/03/30 returns this
error when trying to display big.svg:

java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: java.net.URL: method getPath()Ljava/lang/String;
not found
        at
org.apache.batik.util.ParsedURL$DefaultProtocolParser.parseURL(ParsedURL.java,
Compiled Code)
        at org.apache.batik.util.ParsedURL.parseURL(ParsedURL.java, Compiled Code)
        at org.apache.batik.util.ParsedURL.<init>(ParsedURL.java, Compiled Code)
       at org.apache.batik.util.ParsedURL.parseURL(ParsedURL.java, Compiled Code)
        at org.apache.batik.util.ParsedURL.<init>(ParsedURL.java, Compiled Code)
       at
org.apache.batik.bridge.SVGImageElementBridge.createGraphicsNode(SVGImageElementBridge.java,
Compiled Code)
        at org.apache.batik.bridge.GVTBuilder.buildGraphicsNode(GVTBuilder.java,
Compiled Code)
        at org.apache.batik.bridge.GVTBuilder.buildComposite(GVTBuilder.java,
Compiled Code)
        at org.apache.batik.bridge.GVTBuilder.build(GVTBuilder.java, Compiled Code)
        at org.apache.batik.swing.svg.GVTTreeBuilder.run(GVTTreeBuilder.java,
Compiled Code)

creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
From some simple testing, getPath and getFile appear to be synonyms.
getPath is JDK 1.3 and higher.
So I replaced the use of getPath with getFile.
